channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024021854
item.description:
Report X-2024021854

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered to be leaking powder. It was set aside and QA was informed of its condition and location DescribePack: There is a small puncture on the bottom of the inner bucket, which caused some powder to leak out of the outer box. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat bag and taken to the hazmat cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021876
item.description:
Report X-2024021876

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was left at QA on Tuesday morning in a lined hazmat tote. We inspected the package and found that one of the 4 plastic bottles had a loose cap and it caused a 1/2 gallon of the material to leak out inside the package which contaminated all of the contents in the box. We made sure that the package was isolated under the hood vent inside the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We made sure that the package was isolated inside the hazmat cage upon discovery.

item.title: Report X-2024021424

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021424 SequenceEvent: package found on dock with external leakage. package was then placed into a salvage drum for further investigation. DescribePack: Upon investigation, station had found that there was a loose cap causing internal leakage on one of the four inner containers. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed into a hazard bag, and then into a salvage drum. 2. X-2024021425 SequenceEvent: Package was found on dock with wet outer packaging. Package was then placed in a salvage drum for further investigation DescribePack: Upon investigation, station found that there was a loose cap on one of the four inner containers. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a harzard bag, then into a salvage drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE IC BELT ALREADY OUTSIDE OF THE EXTERIOR FIBERBOARD BOX. WE WERE WERE CALLED BECAUSE OF THE LEAK AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS BUCKET/PAIL. IT WAS ALREADY CONTAINED IN A LINED TOTE. WE DISCOVERED A CRACK ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET. DescribePack: 10 INCH CRACK ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BUCKET DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE MADE SURE THAT WE ISOLATED THIS PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REFUSED BY CUSTOMER AND TAKEN BACK TO STATION PLASED IN A PLASTIC PAIL. MOVED TO QA STAGING LOCATION DescribePack: BOTTEM OF PAIL CREAKED OPEN CONTENT LEAKED OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: MOVED FROM THE QA STAGING LOCATION TO HAZNAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2024021150
item.description:
Report X-2024021150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found outside in a trailer laying on its side by our safety specialist Stacy Moore. Package was brought inside to the hazmat cage for inspection. During inspection it was found that the metal cap had become loose and fell off of the metal container. This caused the liquid contents to spill all throughout the plastic bag holding the metal can. Some of the contents spilled onto another hazmat, causing only the outer package to get wet. No damage was done. DescribePack: The cause of the failure was due to improper loading. The package clearly stated that this hazmat must be placed upright. This was not followed as the hazmat was found lying on its side. This caused the metal cap to come loose and liquid contents to spill throughout packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further vaper and leakage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding one damaged carboy containing Trifluoroacetic Anhydride (UN3265). The damage was a result of improper loafing/inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately one-gallon of product released onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor cleaned-up the spilled material and containerized the damaged carboy for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the unload area. Upon looking at the package it was discovered that the package was leaking. Package was placed in a lined hazmat bag inside of a tote and brought to the QA area for further investigation DescribePack: Upon further investigation, it was discovered that the cap on the container was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag inside of a plastic tote

item.title: Report X-2024021340
item.description:
Report X-2024021340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put on the IC rollers and then it moved onto the van line belt. Package handler was not aware of the package coming up from the IC rollers which caused the package to fall from the belt onto the van line platform. The fall caused a dent in the framing where the lid was secured which caused the lid to be removed partially releasing 4 out of 5 gallons of the chemical onto the van platform and the ground bellow it. No other packages where damaged in this incident. DescribePack: Small dent on the top portion of the bucket keeping the lid from being secured further. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was delivered to QA Immediately and spill was cleaned up with dry dirt.

DescribePack: After further investigation of the package, it was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap and spilled inside of the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a tote and brought to the QA area.

item.title: Report X-2024020832
item.description:
Report X-2024020832

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA due to damage to package. 1 of 4 bottles (128 ounces each) leaked through its cap causing corrosive liquid to spill onto the other 3 bottles. and the box itself. QA cleaned up the corrosive liquid and placed package into protective bag and bin and brought to QA. DescribePack: Plastic closure under lid was not strong enough for corrosive liquid content inside, which caused the liquid to leak through the lid and onto the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into protective plastic and hazmat safe bin
